root.name: min()

example.code: d = min(5, 9) # Sets 'd' to 5 e = min(-4, -12) # Sets 'e' to -12 f = min(12.3, 230.24) # Sets 'f' to 12.3
values = 5, 1, 2, -3 # Create an array of ints h = min(values) # Sets 'h' to -3

root.description: Determines the smallest value in a sequence of numbers, and then returns that value. min() accepts either two or three float or int values as parameters, or an array of any length.
